articles.article: We build our computer (systems) the way we build our cities: over time, without a plan, on top of ruins.
articles.author: Ellen Ullman

articles.article: The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
articles.author: Anonymous

articles.article: If it's a good idea, go ahead and do it. It's much easier to apologize than it is to get permission.
articles.author: Grace Hopper

articles.article: The city’s central computer told you?  R2D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer!
articles.author: C-3PO

articles.article: I have always wished for my computer to be as easy to use as my telephone; my wish has come true because I can no longer figure out how to use my telephone.
articles.author: Bjarne Stroustrup

articles.article: Understand well as I may, my comprehension can only be an infinitesimal fraction of all I want to understand.
articles.author: Ada Lovelace

articles.article: Java is to JavaScript as ham is to hamster.
articles.author: Jeremy Keith

articles.article: The most dangerous phrase in the language is, "We've always done it this way."
articles.author: Grace Hopper

articles.article: As soon as we started programming, we found to our surprise that it wasn’t as easy to get programs right as we had thought.  Debugging had to be discovered.  I can remember the exact instant when I realized that a large part of my life from then on was going to be spent in finding mistakes in my own programs.
articles.author: Maurice Wilkes

articles.article: Learning to write programs stretches your mind, and helps you think better, creates a way of thinking about things that I think is helpful in all domains.
articles.author: Bill Gates

articles.article: What one programmer can do in one month, two programmers can do in two months.
articles.author: Fred Brooks

articles.article: The Internet? Is that thing still around?
articles.author: Homer Simpson

articles.article: If you tell me precisely what it is a machine cannot do, then I can always make a machine which will do just that.
articles.author: Jon von Neumann
